column1: Đông Hà (listen) is the capital of Quảng Trị Province
column2: Vietnam. Đông Hà is situated at the crossroads of National Highway 1A and Route 9
column3: part of the East–West Economic Corridor (EWEC). It lies on the North–South Railway (Reunification Express) and is served by Đông Hà Railway Station. EWEC is an economic development program which includes northeast Thailand

column2: Đông Hà was the northernmost town in South Vietnam and was the location of a strategically important United States Marine Corps Đông Hà Combat Base
column3: to support Marine positions along the Vietnamese Demilitarized Zone (DMZ).  The 3rd Marine Division had overall command and control of this operational area.  Large numbers of NVA operated in the DMZ area. 3rd Marine Division intelligence estimated the combat strength of NVA and VC forces in the DMZ area in January 1968 was 40
